<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>For the first day in 52 years, we have good news to share: ESPN reports the NBA will restart the season in Orlando, FL, beginning on July 31. </span><span><strong style="color:#000">Markets: </strong></span><span>If you’re looking at the surging stock market and thinking to yourself, “Boy I’ve never seen anything like this”...you’d be correct. This is the S&P’s </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/03/this-is-the-greatest-50-day-rally-in-the-history-of-the-sp-500.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">biggest 50-day rally ever</a></span><span>, per LPL Financial. And the Nasdaq is </span><span><a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/the-nasdaq-trades-within-2-of-a-record-high-as-the-unbearable-lightness-of-the-stock-market-continues-2020-06-03?mod=home-page&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">within 2%</a></span><span> of an all time high. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Global economy: </strong></span><span>For the first time in 29 years, Australia’s economy is </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/3ec4cb31689cfd257c95a3672fc58eda?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">in a recession</a></span><span> (defined as two straight quarters of negative GDP growth). A global pandemic will do that.</span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOPOLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/03/un-red-cross-warn-vaccine-nationalism?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Punctured Arms Race
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Two syringes shaped like rockets " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjE2L3N5cmluZ2Vfcm9ja2V0cy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The next great geopolitical battle of our time is being fought not over rocket launches or Olympic hockey, but in the labs of scientists working to develop a vaccine for the coronavirus. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a program it’s calling Operation Warp Speed, the Trump administration is working with seven pharma companies to produce a COVID-19 vaccine, <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-03/white-house-working-with-seven-drugmakers-in-warp-speed-push?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bloomberg reports</a>. They include Moderna, Johnson & Johnson, Merck, Pfizer, and an Oxford University/AstraZeneca combo. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The goal is to have </span><span><a href="https://abcnews.go.com/Health/coronavirus-updates-us-100-million-doses-vaccine-end/story?id=71038663&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">100 million doses</a></span><span> of a vaccine by the end of the year, said Dr. Anthony Fauci, the nation’s top infectious disease expert. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Meanwhile, China is also racing to develop its own vaccine—it’s <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2020/06/03/coronavirus-vaccine-global-race/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">currently testing</a> five potential options. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Experts call it “vaccine nationalism”</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The coronavirus will hang over the global economy for as long as it takes to develop a vaccine—restaurants won’t operate at full capacity, concert venues won’t be packed, and travel will be subdued until populations are immune. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So the country that produces a vaccine first will be able to unleash economic growth it likely won’t want to share with peers (as they say, secure your own mask before helping others). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Vaccine nationalism in the wild: </strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Remdesivir, Gilead Sciences’ potential coronavirus treatment, could bring in </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-remdesivir/gileads-remdesivir-could-see-7-billion-in-annual-sales-on-stockpiling-boost-analyst-idUSKBN23A2MN?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$7 billion in annual revenue</a></span><span> by 2022, SVB Leerink said Wednesday. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The reason? Governments will stockpile the drug for their own citizens in case of future outbreaks. Keep in mind, remdesivir isn’t even a vaccine...and it doesn’t have formal U.S. approval yet.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But vaccine nationalism could be harmful </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Health leaders at Harvard have called it “<a href="https://hbr.org/2020/05/the-danger-of-vaccine-nationalism?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">morally reprehensible</a>.” And yesterday, the UN and the Red Cross <a href="https://media.ifrc.org/ifrc/press-release/joint-statement-uniting-peoples-vaccine-covid-19/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">urged</a> countries to drop the turf war and create a “people’s vaccine,” one that protects “the affluent in cities as the poor in rural communities, the old in care homes as the young in refugee camps.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Those arguments aren’t likely to resonate with President Trump or Chinese President Xi Jinping, who are looking for any advantage in their battle for economic supremacy.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
VC
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/03/major-venture-capital-firms-announce-initiatives-addressing-racial-inequality?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Venture Capital Puts Its Money Where Its Money Is
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As protests decrying police brutality and racial inequality continue across the country, big players in venture capital <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/03/softbank-announces-100-million-fund-for-minority-owned-businesses.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are reckoning</a> with the sector’s overwhelming whiteness. From 1990–2016, black Americans accounted for <a href="https://afrotech.com/five-black-led-vc-firms-to-watch?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">less than 1%</a> of the entrepreneurial and venture capital labor pool. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Japanese conglomerate SoftBank unveiled a $100 million “Opportunity Fund” reserved exclusively for companies led by people of color. SoftBank will skip the management fee, and half of all gains will be reinvested into future opportunity funds. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Classic SoftBank—it put together the fund in 24 hours. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Silicon Valley heavyweight Andreessen Horowitz also <a href="https://a16z.com/2020/06/03/talent-x-opportunity/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rolled out</a> a “Talent x Opportunity Fund,” which is geared toward “entrepreneurs who have the talent, drive, and ideas to build great businesses but lack the typical background and resources to do so.” </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The VC world is a notoriously clubby one, where it’s hard to break in without a network. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Venture capital is the coal that fuels much of the tech world’s fire, so improving VC diversity may help encourage equity across Silicon Valley.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Virtual event: </strong>If you're interested, a group called BLCK VC is hosting an event tomorrow that will feature black investors and founders talking about their struggles in tech. <a href="https://wewontwait.splashthat.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">It starts at noon PT</a>.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/03/snapchat-will-no-longer-promote-trumps-account?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Spiegel Makes a Snap Decision
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Evan Spiegel" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjEzL2V2YW5fc3BpZWdlbC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Michael Kovac/Getty Images for Vanity Fair</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Snap CEO Evan Spiegel announced Snapchat <a href="https://www.axios.com/snapchat-discover-trump-account-bbdfa6b8-f0cb-4c01-9a9d-c3dcb9b3de4e.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">would no longer</a> promote President Trump’s account on its Discover page. Makes sense—after all, the company is built on making things disappear. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The twist: </strong></span><span>The decision was prompted by comments Trump made on Twitter, </span><span><em>not</em></span><span> Snapchat, which Spiegel described as promoting racism and violence. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The statement immediately inserted Snap into the broader scuffle between President Trump and social media. Last week, Twitter labeled some of Trump’s tweets as misleading. Then on Thursday, Trump fired back with an executive order that aimed to crack one of the social media industry’s core legal foundations. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In contrast to Twitter (and now Snap), Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg said he has no plans to touch Trump’s posts, despite a </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/01/facebook-employees-stage-virtual-walkout-protest-zuckerbergs-censorship-stance?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">virtual employee walkout</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> UN special rapporteur on freedom of opinion and expression David Kaye <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/03/technology/snapchat-trump.html?smtyp=cur&smid=tw-nytimes&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the NYT</a> Snap’s announcement shows social media companies have options other than “leave-up or takedown” when it comes to controversial posts.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

</a>
</td>

</h3>

Decades of Investing Know-How, All Yours
</font></a>
</h1>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Remember our friends at <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N2992.3407870MORNINGBREW/B23591364.272746087;dc_trk_aid=467700369;dc_trk_cid=100857211;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vanguard</a>, the financial experts who've been helping individual investors reach their goals for more than 25 years? Of course you do. But did you know they have a new online advice platform that puts all that experience at your fingertips?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It's called <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N2992.3407870MORNINGBREW/B23591364.272746087;dc_trk_aid=467700369;dc_trk_cid=100857211;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vanguard Digital Advisor<sup style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;">TM</sup></a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It's a new robo-advisor with some pretty powerful technology that lets you <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N2992.3407870MORNINGBREW/B23591364.272746087;dc_trk_aid=467700369;dc_trk_cid=100857211;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">test out different scenarios</a> for when you might retire and how much you want to save before you get there. (By the way, you can play around with this tool before you even enroll in the service.)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Then Digital Advisor <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N2992.3407870MORNINGBREW/B23591364.272746087;dc_trk_aid=467700369;dc_trk_cid=100857211;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">takes the guesswork out of managing your investments</a> by doing it for you. It translates your retirement plan and your feelings about risk into an ongoing investment strategy.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Learn how <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N2992.3407870MORNINGBREW/B23591364.272746087;dc_trk_aid=467700369;dc_trk_cid=100857211;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vanguard Digital Advisor*</a> can work for you.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID-19
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/03/coronavirus-trends-coming-focus?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What’s Up / What’s Down
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Warhol" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjEyL3dhcmhvbC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>MoMA</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like a bad rash, What's Up / What's Down is back—because how else are you going to keep track of COVID-19 trends?</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/chart-with-upwards-trend_1f4c8.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> What’s up</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Andy Warhol inspo:</strong> Campbell reported a 35% increase in U.S. soup sales over the past three months. Near the beginning of the pandemic, <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/03/business/campbell-soup-surge-earnings/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">soup demand was up 140%</a> as consumers stocked up on stock.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Clocking in: </strong>Mark Zandi, chief economist at Moody’s Analytics, is in a chipper mood. “The good news is I think the recession is over, the Covid-19 recession is over,” he told CNBC. The reason for his optimism? Yesterday, ADP’s private payroll report showed employers cut <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/03/adp-private-payrolls-may-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">far fewer jobs</a> than expected last month. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/chart-with-downwards-trend_1f4c9.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt="">Whats down</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Lights, cameras, and action:</strong> Things are <em>Sharknado 5 </em>levels of ugly for the world's largest theater chain. AMC said yesterday it has “substantial doubt" it can remain in business after losing between <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/03/media/amc-theatres-business-coronavirus/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$2.1 billion and $2.4 billion</a> in Q1. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bathtubs in the kitchen: </strong>The number of Manhattan real estate contracts signed in May fell 84% compared to last year. Deals worth $4 million or more are down almost 90%, as COVID-19 shutdowns as well as recent protests have all but paralyzed an already <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/03/manhattan-real-estate-deals-plunge-84percent-in-may-amid-coronavirus-protests.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">oversaturated</a> luxury market. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AGRICULTURE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/03/top-executives-major-us-chicken-suppliers-accused-price-fixing?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
One Count of Price Fixing With a Side of Fries, Please
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, top chicken industry moguls, including the CEO of Pilgrim’s Pride, were <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-pilgrims-pride-charges/u-s-indicts-pilgrims-pride-corp-ceo-for-alleged-chicken-price-fixing-idUSKBN23A2TF?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">indicted by a federal grand jury</a> on charges of price fixing. The suit alleges that execs at Pilgrim's Pride and Claxton Poultry Farms conspired to fix prices and rig bids for chickens from 2012 to at least 2017. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Pilgrim's and Claxton are suppliers for KFC and Chick-fil-A, respectively. And Pilgrim's is the country's No. 2 producer. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Birds of a feather flock together </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The U.S. chicken landscape is dominated by five major players that control 61% of production. Given that level of consolidation, <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/03/business/chicken-executives-indicted-price-fixing/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">accusations of collusion</a> in the chicken coop have plagued the $65 billion industry for years. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Restaurant supply companies and other mega poultry buyers, like Walmart and Albertsons, have brought price fixing lawsuits against the industry in the past. The chicken producers have denied those allegations.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">And what about prices? </strong>The wholesale cost of poultry increased 11% from mid-2012 through 2018, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/chicken-industry-executives-including-pilgrim-s-pride-ceo-indicted-for-price-fixing-11591202113#:~:text=Jacob%20Bunge,-Biography&text=The%20CEO%20of%20one%20of,a%20continuing%20criminal%20antitrust%20probe.?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the WSJ</a>, but it did fall 27% between January 2019 and the end of February 2020.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/03/brews-bookshelf-learning-race-america?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Brew’s Bookshelf
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="books" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82ODIvYnJld19zX2Jvb2tzaGVsZi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Every other Thursday, we’re bringing you a few of the Brew’s favorite, business-related reads. But today's recs are a bit different—they're dedicated to continuing the conversation around racial inequality in America.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="http://isabelwilkerson.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Warmth of Other Suns</em></a></span><span>, a Pulitzer Prize-winning book by journalist Isabel Wilkerson, is a narrative history of three African Americans who left the South during the Great Migration.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.hup.harvard.edu/catalog.php?isbn=9780674237476&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Color of Money</em></a></span><span> by Mehrsa Baradaran examines the racial wealth gap through the lens of black banks and challenges arguments that a segregated economic system is able to self-correct.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.ibramxkendi.com/stamped-from-the-beginning?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Stamped from the Beginning</em></a></span><span> by Ibram X. Kendi chronicles the formation of racist ideas and their power in American history through the stories of five prominent American intellectuals.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="http://www.nafissathompsonspires.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Heads of the Colored People</em></a></span><span><em> </em></span><span>by Nafissa Thompson-Spires is a collection of short stories exploring the tensions of black identity and the contemporary middle class in America.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We are committed to using this series to elevate a diverse group of authors. If you have suggestions for business-related books, please feel free to <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/O2tX0X?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">share with us here.</a></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On this date in 1984, Bruce Springsteen released the album <em>Born in the U.S.A</em>. See if you can fill in the blank lyrics to the title track.</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>I was born in the ______  </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Born down in a ______  / The first kick I took was when I hit the ground</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Got in a little hometown jam / So they put a rifle _______</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>I had a brother at Khe Sanh / Fighting off the ________</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Down in the shadow of the ________ / Out by the gas fires of the refinery</span></li>
</ol>
</td>
</tr>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMarkets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIf you’re looking at the surging stock market and thinking to yourself, “Boy I’ve never seen anything like this”...you’d be correct. This is the S\u0026P’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/03/this-is-the-greatest-50-day-rally-in-the-history-of-the-sp-500.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebiggest 50-day rally ever\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, per LPL Financial. And the Nasdaq is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/the-nasdaq-trades-within-2-of-a-record-high-as-the-unbearable-lightness-of-the-stock-market-continues-2020-06-03?mod=home-page\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewithin 2%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of an all time high. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGlobal economy: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFor the first time in 29 years, Australia’s economy is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/3ec4cb31689cfd257c95a3672fc58eda?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ein a recession\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e (defined as two straight quarters of negative GDP growth). A global pandemic will do that.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nGEOPOLITICS \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/03/un-red-cross-warn-vaccine-nationalism?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThe Punctured Arms Race\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Two syringes shaped like rockets \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjE2L3N5cmluZ2Vfcm9ja2V0cy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe next great geopolitical battle of our time is being fought not over rocket launches or Olympic hockey, but in the labs of scientists working to develop a vaccine for the coronavirus. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a program it’s calling Operation Warp Speed, the Trump administration is working with seven pharma companies to produce a COVID-19 vaccine, \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-03/white-house-working-with-seven-drugmakers-in-warp-speed-push?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eBloomberg reports\u003c/a\u003e. They include Moderna, Johnson \u0026 Johnson, Merck, Pfizer, and an Oxford University/AstraZeneca combo. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe goal is to have \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://abcnews.go.com/Health/coronavirus-updates-us-100-million-doses-vaccine-end/story?id=71038663\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e100 million doses\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of a vaccine by the end of the year, said Dr. Anthony Fauci, the nation’s top infectious disease expert. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMeanwhile, China is also racing to develop its own vaccine—it’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2020/06/03/coronavirus-vaccine-global-race/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecurrently testing\u003c/a\u003e five potential options. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eExperts call it “vaccine nationalism”\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe coronavirus will hang over the global economy for as long as it takes to develop a vaccine—restaurants won’t operate at full capacity, concert venues won’t be packed, and travel will be subdued until populations are immune. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo the country that produces a vaccine first will be able to unleash economic growth it likely won’t want to share with peers (as they say, secure your own mask before helping others). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eVaccine nationalism in the wild: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eRemdesivir, Gilead Sciences’ potential coronavirus treatment, could bring in \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-remdesivir/gileads-remdesivir-could-see-7-billion-in-annual-sales-on-stockpiling-boost-analyst-idUSKBN23A2MN?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$7 billion in annual revenue\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e by 2022, SVB Leerink said Wednesday. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe reason? Governments will stockpile the drug for their own citizens in case of future outbreaks. Keep in mind, remdesivir isn’t even a vaccine...and it doesn’t have formal U.S. approval yet.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut vaccine nationalism could be harmful \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHealth leaders at Harvard have called it “\u003ca href=\"https://hbr.org/2020/05/the-danger-of-vaccine-nationalism?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emorally reprehensible\u003c/a\u003e.” And yesterday, the UN and the Red Cross \u003ca href=\"https://media.ifrc.org/ifrc/press-release/joint-statement-uniting-peoples-vaccine-covid-19/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eurged\u003c/a\u003e countries to drop the turf war and create a “people’s vaccine,” one that protects “the affluent in cities as the poor in rural communities, the old in care homes as the young in refugee camps.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThose arguments aren’t likely to resonate with President Trump or Chinese President Xi Jinping, who are looking for any advantage in their battle for economic supremacy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nVenture Capital Puts Its Money Where Its Money Is\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs protests decrying police brutality and racial inequality continue across the country, big players in venture capital \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/03/softbank-announces-100-million-fund-for-minority-owned-businesses.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare reckoning\u003c/a\u003e with the sector’s overwhelming whiteness. From 1990–2016, black Americans accounted for \u003ca href=\"https://afrotech.com/five-black-led-vc-firms-to-watch?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eless than 1%\u003c/a\u003e of the entrepreneurial and venture capital labor pool. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Japanese conglomerate SoftBank unveiled a $100 million “Opportunity Fund” reserved exclusively for companies led by people of color. SoftBank will skip the management fee, and half of all gains will be reinvested into future opportunity funds. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eClassic SoftBank—it put together the fund in 24 hours. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSilicon Valley heavyweight Andreessen Horowitz also \u003ca href=\"https://a16z.com/2020/06/03/talent-x-opportunity/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erolled out\u003c/a\u003e a “Talent x Opportunity Fund,” which is geared toward “entrepreneurs who have the talent, drive, and ideas to build great businesses but lack the typical background and resources to do so.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe VC world is a notoriously clubby one, where it’s hard to break in without a network. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eVenture capital is the coal that fuels much of the tech world’s fire, so improving VC diversity may help encourage equity across Silicon Valley.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Virtual event: \u003c/strong\u003eIf you're interested, a group called BLCK VC is hosting an event tomorrow that will feature black investors and founders talking about their struggles in tech. \u003ca href=\"https://wewontwait.splashthat.com/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eIt starts at noon PT\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Snap CEO Evan Spiegel announced Snapchat \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/snapchat-discover-trump-account-bbdfa6b8-f0cb-4c01-9a9d-c3dcb9b3de4e.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewould no longer\u003c/a\u003e promote President Trump’s account on its Discover page. Makes sense—after all, the company is built on making things disappear. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe twist: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe decision was prompted by comments Trump made on Twitter, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003enot\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Snapchat, which Spiegel described as promoting racism and violence. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe statement immediately inserted Snap into the broader scuffle between President Trump and social media. Last week, Twitter labeled some of Trump’s tweets as misleading. Then on Thursday, Trump fired back with an executive order that aimed to crack one of the social media industry’s core legal foundations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn contrast to Twitter (and now Snap), Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg said he has no plans to touch Trump’s posts, despite a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/01/facebook-employees-stage-virtual-walkout-protest-zuckerbergs-censorship-stance?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evirtual employee walkout\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e UN special rapporteur on freedom of opinion and expression David Kaye \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/03/technology/snapchat-trump.html?smtyp=cur\u0026amp;smid=tw-nytimes\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold the NYT\u003c/a\u003e Snap’s announcement shows social media companies have options other than “leave-up or Near the beginning of the pandemic, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/03/business/campbell-soup-surge-earnings/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esoup demand was up 140%\u003c/a\u003e as consumers stocked up on stock.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eClocking in: \u003c/strong\u003eMark Zandi, chief economist at Moody’s Analytics, is in a chipper mood. “The good news is I think the recession is over, the Covid-19 recession is over,” he told CNBC. The reason for his optimism? Yesterday, ADP’s private payroll report showed employers cut \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/03/adp-private-payrolls-may-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efar fewer jobs\u003c/a\u003e than expected last month. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/chart-with-downwards-trend_1f4c9.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003eWhats down\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLights, cameras, and action:\u003c/strong\u003e Things are \u003cem\u003eSharknado 5 \u003c/em\u003elevels of ugly for the world's largest theater chain. AMC said yesterday it has “substantial doubt\" it can remain in business after losing between \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/03/media/amc-theatres-business-coronavirus/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$2.1 billion and $2.4 billion\u003c/a\u003e in Q1. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBathtubs in the kitchen: \u003c/strong\u003eThe number of Manhattan real estate contracts signed in May fell 84% compared to last year. Please\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, top chicken industry moguls, including the CEO of Pilgrim’s Pride, were \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-pilgrims-pride-charges/u-s-indicts-pilgrims-pride-corp-ceo-for-alleged-chicken-price-fixing-idUSKBN23A2TF?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eindicted by a federal grand jury\u003c/a\u003e on charges of price fixing. The suit alleges that execs at Pilgrim's Pride and Claxton Poultry Farms conspired to fix prices and rig bids for chickens from 2012 to at least 2017. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePilgrim's and Claxton are suppliers for KFC and Chick-fil-A, respectively. And Pilgrim's is the country's No. 2 producer. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBirds of a feather flock together \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe U.S. chicken landscape is dominated by five major players that control 61% of production. Given that level of consolidation, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/03/business/chicken-executives-indicted-price-fixing/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaccusations of collusion\u003c/a\u003e in the chicken coop have plagued the $65 billion industry for years. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRestaurant supply companies and other mega poultry buyers, like Walmart and Albertsons, have brought price fixing lawsuits against the industry in the past. The chicken producers have denied those allegations.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnd what about prices? \u003c/strong\u003eThe wholesale cost of poultry increased 11% from mid-2012 through 2018, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/chicken-industry-executives-including-pilgrim-s-pride-ceo-indicted-for-price-fixing-11591202113#:~:text=Jacob%20Bunge,-Biography\u0026text=The%20CEO%20of%20one%20of,a%20continuing%20criminal%20antitrust%20probe.?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper the WSJ\u003c/a\u003e, but it did fall 27% between January 2019 and
